comments.creator: sdaugherty@gmail.com
comments.author: sdaugherty@gmail.com
comments.text: This is related to bug 554174. In cases where the browser won't start, there should be a command line invocation of firefox that will give parsable about:support and about:plugins reports for support purposes
comments.raw_text: This is related to bug 554174. In cases where the browser won't start, there should be a command line invocation of firefox that will give parsable about:support and about:plugins reports for support purposes

comments.creator: adw@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: That sounds hard, since about:support/plugins can't run if the app won't start.  Maybe they could be periodically written to a file.  Then the user could look at it manually, or the command-line handler, if given a flag, could launch it or dump it to the terminal, assuming app startup could get that far.
comments.text: That sounds hard, since about:support/plugins can't run if the app won't start.  Maybe they could be periodically written to a file.  Then the user could look at it manually, or the command-line handler, if given a flag, could launch it or dump it to the terminal, assuming app startup could get that far.
